intro: Astronia sorongensis, commonly known as the Sorong astrolabe, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
